column4: Good afternoon, everyone.  I'm having a problem with the Ubuntu Installer on a Mac Mini.  I see the purple boot screen, and I can select "Try Ubuntu before Installing" or "Install Ubuntu", but either way, when I do, I lose signal to my monitor, and my disk drive just clicks around for a while.  I've tried waiting 20 minutes, but nothing ever happens.  Is there any troubleshooting or anything I can do here?
Not the HD.  The DVD drive.  It sounds like it's trying to read stuff, ZenMasta.  Not really a click, more...the drive working furiously at reads.
did u burn the CD at low speed?
you have to.
It's a new disk.  And no, I didn't.  I tried three different images (32 bit 11.14, 64 bit 11.14, 10.12), and all three have the same issue.
check md5sum of .iso or download using .torrent, then burn th cd at the lowest speed possible
And all the MD5 sums are correct on all three isos.
ok, so the problem is your driver
But I will try again burning the DVD at low speed.
The driver?
drive
sorry
you can also install using a USB
pendrive I mean
Any clue how to boot from a pendrive on a Mac?
hi

The thing is, I guess, I don't think it's the drive:  A Debian install disk works just fine; the only problem is that Debian doesn't seem to have support for the Ethernet Card I have, so I can't really use that unless I find a way to get the driver in.  And I tried the Ubuntu disk in a MacBook Pro and it worked fine.  It's just this Mac Mini, which is weird.
try ##hardware (maybe u need a registered nick)
All right.  Thanks.
lol
##mac
Wouldn't that channel be more for Mac OS X type stuff?
